New Records: Mohammed Shami became the first Indian bowler to pick more than five-wicket haul in ODI World Cups
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored 95 to steer India's successful run chase against New Zealand
Mohammed Shami picked 5 for 54 off 10 overs
Ravindra Jadeja hit the winning runs in the same over to hand New Zealand their first defeat of the ongoing World Cup
Shreyas Iyer was dismissed in the 22nd over
KL Rahul fell in the 33rd over
Suryakumar Yadav's tragic run-out in the 34th over
Ravindra Jadeja was batting for the first time in this World Cup
Mohammed Siraj dismissed Devon Conway for a duck
Mohammed Shami bowled Will Young with a peach of a delivery
Pre-Game Insights: India needed to balance Hardik Pandya's absence by leaving out Shardul Thakur and bringing in Suryakumar Yadav
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli is now the leading run-scorer in this year's World Cup
India have chased all five times in this edition of the World Cup
India are now on top of the points table, having won all their five matches so far in the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Indian victory was scripted by Virat Kohli and a stunning spell from Mohammed Shami
The dew was expected to settle in quicker than at other venues
Play was halted briefly because of fog in Dharamshala
India lost their way in the chase soon after: Shreyas Iyer was dismissed in the 22nd over, KL Rahul fell in the 33rd over, and then came Suryakumar Yadav's tragic run-out
Ravindra Jadeja was batting for the first time in this World Cup
The required run-rate was manageable and Kohli and Jadeja were able to steer India home to a memorable victory
